intro: Cacalia michoacana, commonly known as the Michoacan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is found in the state of Michoacán, hence its name. It produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
